channel.title: Storbeck Blog
channel.description: Technical blog by Geoff Storbeck covering frontend development, web performance, security, DevOps, and practical tooling.

item.title: What Is a CTA? Why We Need One
item.description: What a CTA is, why it matters, and practical ways to guide users with clear calls to action without losing your product’s voice.

item.title: A Tiny MCP To Track App Store Feedback
item.description: Keep a free, daily pulse by pulling App Store reviews into an AI‑enabled loop, bucketing wins vs fixes, and shipping low‑hanging improvements fast.

item.title: React Context vs Zustand vs Jotai — A Visual Guide
item.description: See why Context rerenders every consumer and how Zustand/Jotai keep updates narrow — three tiny, dependency‑free demos with render counters.

item.title: Bodywork and Interfaces
item.description: Note from time around auto body repair shops, and why interfaces need the same patient, layer-by-layer inspection if you want them to actually shine.

item.title: Vibe Coding Fundamentals — Practical AI‑Powered Development
item.description: Announcing my ebook: Vibe Coding Fundamentals — practical guidance for shipping real features with AI as a staff engineer.

item.title: Automating Persona‑Driven Usability Testing with Playwright MCP
item.description: Automate persona‑driven usability testing with Playwright MCP. Use a demo repo of personas and system instructions to generate screenshots and UX reports. Fast signal before real studies.

item.title: Tombstones, Timestamps, and Gossip: Cassandra’s Way of Staying Consistent
item.description: A conversational tour of Cassandra’s tombstones, timestamps, SSTables, compaction, read repair, and the gossip protocol — plus lessons you can borrow for other systems.

item.title: Browse Tor with Claude (curl + socks5h)
item.description: Browse Tor with Claude using curl over socks5h: simple setup, fast lookups via Ahmia, and how to prompt Claude to find and skim .onion sites like a search engine.

item.title: Textmode Vibes That Move (ASCII → Animated Image)
item.description: Make a moving, zine‑style background by generating ASCII art with Linux tools and rendering it into an animated image with ImageMagick—no CSS or JavaScript required.

item.title: Light & Color Ideas for Modern Frontend
item.description: Practical UI patterns: modular rhythm, natural motion, OKLCH palettes, hierarchy, tiny charts, and accessible status—with an interactive palette and copy‑paste code.

item.title: Gooey SVG (No CSS/JS)
item.description: Create a gooey, blobby merge effect using pure SVG filters — no external CSS or JavaScript. Includes a minimal filter and two copy/paste examples.

item.title: Don’t Say “Build a Beautiful UI” — Use References
item.description: Don’t prompt agents to ‘build a beautiful UI’. Beauty is undefined. Give concrete visual references and style guides instead. Includes before/after prompts and a calculator mini‑demo with multiple reference styles.

item.title: Hand‑Held Card Fan (Lerped)
item.description: A tiny HTML/CSS/JS demo that fans, opens, and rotates a deck of cards with smooth lerped transforms — no frameworks.

item.title: Give Claude Code Unrestricted Root (via 1Password) — Dangerous, Test-Only
item.description: Security engineering note: how to let Claude Code (or similar agents) obtain root without prompts using a 1Password service account and op CLI. Extremely risky; test-only with strong safeguards.

item.title: Remove Dead Code with Knip (Streamline Before Upgrades)
item.description: Use Knip to find and remove dead code, shrink context for AI and humans, and declutter before big upgrades. Includes quick start and iterative cleanup tips.

item.title: Rainbow Border with Modern CSS (One Rule)
item.description: Minimal, copy‑paste CSS to make a rainbow border using layered backgrounds and conic‑gradient. One rule. No extra markup.

item.title: Drop‑in Lottie Animations
item.description: Drop‑in animations with Lottie web components. Designers export Lottie; developers embed a local .lottie or JSON with one tag—no JavaScript to write or CSS transforms to rebuild.

item.title: Simple Math for Better UI Motion
item.description: Use noise, nonlinear intensity, and smoothing to make UI motion feel deliberate and calm, not jittery.

item.title: Preventing Secrets from Leaking in Git Repos (Pre‑commit Hook)
item.description: AI can slip secrets into commits. Offensive security teams use Nosey Parker to find credentials; you can use it pre-commit to stop leaks before they land.
